meanings.sent1: The lion was preying on the unsuspecting gazelle in the savanna.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah is preying on the herd of antelope for its next meal.
meanings.sent3: The hawk was preying on the fish in the river, showing its hunting skills.
meanings.sent4: The predator silently preying on its prey, waiting for the perfect moment to strike.
meanings.sent5: The wolf's eyes gleamed with hunger as it started preying on the rabbit.

meanings.sent1: The con artist was preying on unsuspecting victims in the crowded market.
meanings.sent2: Scammers often target vulnerable individuals, preying on their trust.
meanings.sent3: The thief was preying on the wealthy neighborhood, looking for easy targets.
meanings.sent4: Corrupt officials preying on the system for personal gain will face consequences.
meanings.sent5: The fraudster was preying on the elderly, taking advantage of their kindness.

meanings.sent1: The villagers believed the curse was preying on their crops, causing them to fail.
meanings.sent2: Superstitions can lead people to think evil spirits are preying on their homes.
meanings.sent3: The rumor was preying on the minds of the students, causing unnecessary fear.
meanings.sent4: Doubt can start preying on your confidence if you let it linger in your thoughts.
meanings.sent5: Negativity can be like a shadow, always preying on your happiness if you allow it.
